summary: The EFTA Court of Justice, commonly referred to as the EFTA Court, serves as a judicial body for the European Free Trade Association (EFTA) member states. It ensures the uniform interpretation and application of the EFTA Agreement, akin to the role of the Court of Justice of the European Union (CJEU) within the EU framework. The EFTA Court adjudicates disputes involving EFTA states, providing legal clarity and regulatory coherence in the context of European integration. As a redirect, this entry emphasizes the preferred term "EFTA Court," highlighting its significance in EU legal and regulatory documents, particularly regarding cross-border trade and economic cooperation.
